question_content.barrons:question: Credit is (i)________, and hard for even one person to hold onto, but (ii)________, sticky as honey, goes everywhere and sticks to everyone.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
slippery; blame.

The explicit contrast here is between credit, in the sense of praise, and blame, in the sense of censure or reproof. Credit is described as hard to hold onto. Thus. it is slippery.

Bankrupt is incorrect. Credit here is being used in the sense of praise. Bankrupt makes no sense in this context.

Marginal is incorrect. Credit here is being used in the sense of praise. Marginal makes no sense in this context.

Misfortune is incorrect. The missing word must be an antonym or near-antonym for credit (praise).

Misfortune makes no sense in this context.

Sweetness is incorrect. The missing word must be an antonym or near-antonym for credit (praise). Sweetness makes no sense in this context.
